Case reference: 2012020095.CaseDesc: On February 21, 2006, between 8:00 and 8:30 am Draper Jim was dropped off on the road by the Health Center on the Saulteaux First Nation (North of Cochin, Saskatchewan). Draper was attempting to return home to the Witchekan First Nation and has not been seen since.

Scar: Lower Lip, Left side of lower lip
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Ying Yang Symbol

Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2013000091.CaseDesc: An unidentified male was found in False Creek near the Maritime Museum on May 7th 1998. The deceased had a pack of matches from the Bridges restaurant in his pocket

Teeth: Visible Missing, Two front upper teeth on the left side
Foreign Object: Matches found in pocket from Bridges Restaurant

Case reference: 2014008479.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2014 William Grange was on vacation at the Cambridge Beach Resort and Spa in Bermuda. In the evening, he walked away from the resort.

Jewelry: Gold, wedding band with one diamond
Scar: Unknown, Small white scar, approx. 3" long, on top of hand, unknown right or left hand
Left Side Of Head, Surgical scar on left side of head/scalp from brain surgery

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2014004393.CaseDesc: Jean Garnek lived in an apartment block in the McGregor area of the city, where she was known to walk wherever she needed to go. She was also known to use the Winnipeg Transit System.

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2010006499.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2007, Mark Brazau was reported missing by a friend.  Mark was last seen at his place of work in Toronto Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Short, Over ears, receding hairline, beard and a moustache

Case reference: 2018041669.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2003, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Yunerkis Cervantes-Estrada was seen for the last time at her residence in Toronto, Ontario. On the following day, Yunerkis left a note at her house which indicated that she was going to a party.

Case reference: 2020032438.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2020, Jean-Louis Desrosiers was seen for the last time around noon at a business in the city of Gatineau, Quebec. He was driving a 2009 4-door grey Hyundai Elantra. Jean-Louis has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2018034585.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2004, at approximately 8:00 am, Stephen Lawrence was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Stephen had said he would be home in a few hours.

Shirt: Blue, Brand: Calvin Klein; long sleeves

Case reference: 2016068138.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1985, a male was recovered from the Detroit River near Cooper's Marina in the township of Anderdon, County Essex, 5 km north of Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 190-200lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has no obvious scars or tattoos and is uncircumcised. Police believe that this individual is American, based on the clothing labels. It is thought that he had been in the water for as long as two months.

Hair: Black, A small amount of hair was also present on his chin.
Teeth: Most of his teeth are present and there are several amalgam (silver) restorations.
Belt: Leather, Brown, with rivets and a pattern on the leather
Shirt: Gold, Hudson Sport Detroit, short-sleeved  sport shirt with three buttons at the neck
Sweater: Gold, Arnold Palmer Design USA, cardigan
Jacket: Beige, St. John's Bay, hooded with a zipper in front; made in Korea
Hat: Wool, Red, Brown, woolen toque in his pocket

Case reference: 2006002299.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1995, remains from an unidentified man were discovered in Grenadier Pond, also known as “Duck Pond”, in High Park in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014005172.CaseDesc: Debra Marlow was last seen in Kingston Ontario on November 3rd, 2008, where she had a mental health assessment at Kingston General Hospital. She was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Berenice and Berangere Pare were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Berenice and Berangere, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014005581.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2011, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Steven Lapowich was last seen at Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Steven boarded a flight to Puerto Rico, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006028199.CaseDesc: Barbara Sadowski and her husband lived a reclusive lifestyle on Marten Lake, in the Marten River area. She was last seen on the 23 or 24 of June 2006, walking along the beach near her home on Marten Lake.  She was recently in poor health.  She walked at a very slow pace, often using one or two canes or walking sticks.

Hair: Grey, White, Long, Often one or two braids
Teeth: Visible Missing, Poor condition, no teeth, mouth appears sunken
Glasses: Brown, Large frame, older style, thick lenses

Case reference: 2014003880.CaseDesc: Yvon Robitaille was last seen on the evening of April 1, 1996, as he was travelling on 3rd Avenue in Val-d'Or. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005006999.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1981, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 40 to 60 years, was recovered from the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. He was seen jumping from a Ferry Boat by witnesses on board. He was transferred to Toronto General Hospital where he died on August 7, 1981. Staining on his teeth suggests that he was a smoker.

Teeth: Visible Missing, All of his upper teeth are absent and he only has five anterior teeth in his lower jaw.
Shirt: Yellow, A dark yellow shirt with blue and red box stripes
Deformity: Left Leg, Left leg is shorter than his right leg and it is possible that he may have had to wear lifts
Nose, Appears to have been previously broken.
Scar: Left Leg, Scarring on his left outer thigh and lower leg, probable skin donor sites.
Pelvis, Scars on both inguinal (groin) areas, possibly from hernia repairs.

Case reference: 2012020004.CaseDesc: Jafar Imenpour, 74 years of age, who was visiting the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia from Iran, was reported missing on September 25, 2011.  Mr. Imenpour had not returned to his family residence after he had left for a 15 minute walk in Port Coquitlam, B.C. He does not speak English and does not know anyone other than his family in this area.

Case reference: 2014004358.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2003 Rahul Arora was last seen leaving the Trappers Inn in Parry Sound, Ontario.  He was possibly heading to the Toronto area to catch a flight.

Hair: Black, Straight, Ear length, parted in middle, dyed copper

Case reference: 2018063232.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1999, Elizabeth Shelly was last seen as she left the shelter she was staying at in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019042986.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1987, at approximately 8:15am, Anna Lippert was last seen at the Etobicoke General Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003748.CaseDesc: On September 29th, 1996, police were contacted by a friend to report his 3 hunting partners, including Glen Mymryk who were overdue from a hunting trip. He also advised he found one of the barrels from the boat they took, floating towards shore and he could see something on the lake through the binoculars but was unsure what it was. The three men left in a loaded boat and got halfway to their destination when they decided the water conditions were too bad and they turned around. The men were bailing but the waves were too much, the motor stalled and they capsized. Mr. Mymryk was last seen floating away soon after the boat capsized. The lone survivor was rescued 7 hours after the incident and indicate the other 2 men he was with had drowned.

Case reference: 2014005162.CaseDesc: Steve Messervie was seen for the last time on October 6, 2008 in Montreal.  Mr. Messervie had been in hospital, however his identity had not been confirmed through identification documents.  Mr. Messervie had been diagnosed as having amnesia prior to leaving the hospital.

Case reference: 2014004619.CaseDesc: William "Billy Jay" Sharphead was last seen leaving his residence on the Enoch Cree Nation in September of 2003.  On that night it is believed that he got into a car.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014001228.CaseDesc: On June 6, 2004, the remains of a man were recovered from the North Saskatchewan River in Edmonton, Alberta.  There was dental work present.

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978 at his residence in Edson. Mr. Nodeland’s motorcycle and helmet were recovered approximately one month later in a remote area south west of Sundre, Alberta. Mr. Nodeland may have been seen on foot in the area a short time later however he was never located.

Case reference: 2006028099.CaseDesc: Diane Marie Bourne was last seen on March 6, 1976, at her residence in Ashton, Ontario. Extensive police investigation has failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2013000098.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1974, eight men were on a drilling barge. As they were making no headway against a strong current, it was agreed upon to park the barge for the night. The eight men worked together to park the vessel however one of the legs failed to lower, causing the barge to tip. Donald Bradburn was amongst the men who were thrown from the barge. Despite dragging operations Mr. Bradburn has never been located.

Case reference: 2014001632.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Dorion was last seen by a friend at a local fishing camp on September 21, 1999. Ms. Dorion arrived at the fishing camp on the 17th of September with her friends and stayed there approximately 4 days. She was never seen again. Two separate ground searches were carried out. Several steep embankments as well as the area surrounding the camp were searched with negative results. Ms. Dorion's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2017073521.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2017, an unidentified woman was recovered from Lake Ontario near Humber Bay Shores Park, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts she was of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014003020.CaseDesc: On October 7, 1997, Judy Desjarlais and a friend were sitting outside of their shared residence on Cameron Ave, Edmonton, overlooking the North Saskatchewan River. Judy took off running down towards the river. Her friend heard Judy in the river calling for help and went into the water looking for her.

Scar: Chin, Noticeable scar on left chin
Mark: Chin, Mole on left side of chin
Waist, 2 moles, 1 on each side of the stomach

Case reference: 2014003239.CaseDesc: Craig Rain was last seen at a gas station at Range Road 32 and Highway 16 north of Duffield, Alberta. He had been planning to hitch hike into Edmonton, Alberta, from this location.

Case reference: 2014006316.CaseDesc: Andrew William Munro was last seen in Stewart, British Columbia on November 15, 2013. Police and family are concerned for his well being as he needs daily medication. He may be clean shaven or have a goatee. Mr. Munro may have been crossing the border between British Columbia and Alaska. Mr. Munro was a long time lower mainland resident who had recently moved to Stewart, to pursue a career in the logging industry.

Hair: Brown, Short, Sometimes has a goatee.

Case reference: 2012020103.CaseDesc: Police are trying to identify a body retrieved from the sea just off the coast of l'Ile Miscou in New Brunswick by crab fishermen on May 3, 1980. The male was caucasian, with a muscular athletic build. His nose had been broken prior to his death. He also had a bridge with 6 gold and porcelain teeth in the top left side of his mouth and regular fillings in the bottom jaw.

Case reference: 2012020052.CaseDesc: Marilyn Byskal went missing on June 20, 1974, while on a school organized canoe trip. She was last seen at her tent when everyone first woke up in the morning. Most present at the camp felt that Miss Byskal fell into the fast flowing waters of the Grass River, however no one witnessed this. An extensive 10 day water and ground search was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2018041276.CaseDesc:
John Russell Kenny, originally from Ontario, resided without a fixed address in Vancouver, British Columbia. 
Mr. Kenny was known for travelling by train.

Case reference: 2019003520.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2019, Addrienne McRobert was seen for the last time leaving the residence of a friend in Oshawa, Ontario.

Coat: Black, Hooded, "BENCH" written vertically on the back
Tattoo: Left Thigh, Text: Forever & Always & Derek

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: Hellen Ermias and her daughter Lina Tedros entered Canada seeking asylum.  They were provided a temporary apartment but disappeared shortly after with no explanation and without their belongings.

Case reference: 2014005499.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of Friday, October 1st, 2010, Janice Cher Desjarlais and her boyfriend crawled into a dumpster located behind The Center of Hope on Franklin Avenue in Fort McMurray. Janice's boyfriend advised that he left at approximately 7:30 a.m. to go to McDonald’s restaurant. When he returned at around 8:30 a.m., Janice was gone. When he was unable to find her, he suspected that the dumpster may have been emptied during his absence. On October 3rd, video surveillance of the area confirmed that the dumpster had been picked up at 8:22 a.m. on October 1st. It also showed the departure of Janice's boyfriend, but no one else entering or leaving the dumpster. On October 5th, a major excavation of the landfill was started, but by the time the search was completed on October 14th, Janice had not been located.

Case reference: 2013000024.CaseDesc: Susan Dawson was living with, and working for, Terry Murphy for approximately 3 weeks prior to her disappearance. She was last seen in the late hours of November 12, 1985 at a gathering at Terry's house. On November 13, a blue car was seen in Terry's yard. On November 14, at approximately 11:55 a.m., a massive explosion occurred at Terry's residence. Terry's remains were found in the debris but there was no indication that Susan was in the house at the time of the explosion. Investigators suspect foul play, and that Terry had some involvement with Susan's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002701.CaseDesc: On November 25, 1986, Carol Bigtobacco was reported missing to the RCMP. She was 8 years old when she was last seen 3 years earlier on March 19, 1983. It is believed she had wandered off from the family residence on Siksika Nation. She may have suffered from a disability.

Boots: One boot was found, unknown colour

Case reference: 2013000077.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1986, Michael Semergian was seen for the last time in the Outremont District in Montreal, Quebec. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2009004999.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance, Dawn Carisse was a patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital. She is generally very pleasant though suffers from short term memory loss due to cardiac arrest several years earlier.  Dawn Carisse always spoke of leaving the hospital and going to where she believed her family would be. Her family was in the Kirkland Lake area and then moved to Sudbury. She was aware of both, and her possible destinations were Kirkland Lake or Sudbury. She was last seen on Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Parted in centre, short bangs
Luggage: May have had a dark duffle bag in her possession.
Dress: Maroon, Pink, Long dress with faint white flowers, short sleeves and front buttons.

Case reference: 2014005752.CaseDesc: On the early morning of March 31, 2007, Candace Shpeley was last seen in Chilliwack, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Ms. Shpeley, a resident of Abbotsford, British Columbia, was travelling from a friend’s residence on the day of her disappearance. Her vehicle, a 1995 green Pontiac Grand Am, was recovered near the Renfrew sky train station in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014046775.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2014, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Sofia Touila was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sofia had told her friend that she would be going home but did not return.

Case reference: 2021037678.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2021, Vaughn Baumgardt was seen for the last time when he left a residence in Powell River, British Columbia. Vaughn has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Black, Skater, Size 10, known to wear black DVS brand skater shoes

Case reference: 2006003799.CaseDesc: On September 28, 2002, a Black male, believed to be between the ages of 20 to 30 years old, was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 1 mile south of Bluffers Park, at the foot of Brimley Road in Toronto. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs and his length was measured at 5’9”-5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Had natural teeth with no restorations.
Underwear: White, Logo "X-20" on the elastic band. The elastic band was tied on right side, as if they were too big.

Case reference: 2013000094.CaseDesc: Robert Beauchamp was last seen in Montreal on June 22, 1993. He left his home with friends and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014005853.CaseDesc: On Friday August 10, 2012, Bernice Carnahan was last seen from the Rabbit Lake Saskatchewan area at approximately 9:00 a.m. At approximately 11:45 p.m. that evening, Ms. Carnahan's abandoned vehicle was located in the Battleford area near Finlayson Island but her whereabouts remain unknown.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire rimmed

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2002 Anatoli Dibrov went out in the evening for about 1/2 hour. When he came home he appeared secretive. Mr. Dibrov went to bed that evening and that was the last time he was seen. Originally from Russia, it's possible he may have returned.

Boots: Brown, Red, Reddish/brown with red fur trim (only available in Russia)
Gloves: Brown, Grey, Brown mittens or grey gloves

Case reference: 2019050902.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2017, the body of an elderly man was found outside the Westside Church in downtown Vancouver, where he had been sleeping. He was very thin and he had an L-shaped scar on the right side of his lower back.

Case reference: 2014041668.CaseDesc: Lise Fredette was last seen leaving work in the city of Peterborough on the evening of November 12, 2014. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Mrs. Fredette, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2012020110.CaseDesc: On September 23 2000, Nathalie Godbout was seen for the last time in the Saint-Romuald district in Lévis, Quebec. Nathalie was the mother of two children.

Case reference: 2016026481.CaseDesc:
On October 2, 1970, the remains of a Caucasian male were found along Wellington County Road, near Guelph/Cambridge, Ontario. He had severe osteoarthritis in his lumbar area, which may have been painful. Found in close proximity were a yellow carpenter's pencil and a tin spectacle case. 9 various buttons were found: 1 overcoat button, 1 trouser button, 3 shirt buttons, 4 underwear buttons; and some pieces of fabric that may be from a white shirt and white socks were also recovered. 
He is believed to have been deceased for approximately 20 years.

Teeth: His teeth were in excellent condition but did have some marked wear.
Money: Six Canadian and American coins dated 1936-1945
Belt: Leather, Size 32 with a Steer's head buckle
Hat: Grey, FEDORA, Hat band, initials "J.U", "Calhoun's", " Bathersby"

Case reference: 2012020085.CaseDesc: Benjamin Entz was born and raised on the Waldeck Hutterite Colony near Waldeck, SK and resided there up until the time he went missing. He was described by friends and family as being a loner who kept to himself. Mr. Entz left the colony on the evening of 2011-09-18 at which time he was seen driving away on a tractor which was later recovered the following day. The investigation/search for Mr. Entz has involved numerous witness interviews, air and ground searches, and media releases, however he has yet to be located.

Case reference: 2007004799.CaseDesc: Stacy Dilenardi was last seen on November 28, 2005, purchasing some cigarettes at a gas bar in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario (Garden River). He had just moved to Sault Ste. Marie and had recently started a job as a technician with the Ontario Forest Research Institute. Stacy had spoken to his father the day before his disappearance. On November 30, 2005, investigators located his vehicle north of the city on a snowmobile trail.

Case reference: 2014002337.CaseDesc: Timothy Peifer was last seen on the long weekend in September, 2002 in the Caddy Lake area of Manitoba.  Mr. Peifer's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2015044121.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1972, Allen Robert Foy was seen for the last time leaving his home in the Saint-Hubert district of Longueuil, Quebec. Allen Robert said he was travelling on vacation north in the Laurentians to go fishing. He left in his vehicle, a green 1970’s Chrysler Newport which was found 4 or 5 years later, near the Dorval airport in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2016012267.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2016, Lorlene Bone was last seen at a friend’s residence on the Shoal River Indian Reserve in Manitoba. Lorlene is a mother of four and it is out of character for her not to contact her family.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Three hearts

Case reference: 2018063272.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2002, Wayne McMahon was seen for the last time by his building's superintendent in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: Heinz Gamper went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park and did not show up for work when expected.

Case reference: 2014001268.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1998, Terry Jasman wandered off from the Bow City Gravel Pit on the Bow River near Brooks, Alberta.  Terry Jasman's trailer and truck were later found abandoned.

Jeans: Denim, Light Blue, Faded blue jeans

Case reference: 2006013099.CaseDesc: On June 22, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near Petrie Island, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017014424.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2005, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in the South Glenmore Park in Calgary, Alberta. There were two key tags bearing the name “Jay” and a bible, with the name “Jay” written on the inside cover, that were found with the body.

Jeans: Denim, Blue, Medium coloured with fading

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2014002562.CaseDesc: Michael Megraw, from Minnesota, USA, had visited the Katamik Lake area with his brother to go fishing over the September Labour Day weekend in September 1992.  Michael had returned to the US but was reported missing just days later, family indicated he was last seen on September 11, 1992.  RCMP received a call on October 3, 1992, about a truck at Katamik Lake which didn't appear to have been moved since September 24th; Mr. Megraw was determined to be the registered owner.  It is believed he returned to the lake somewhere between September 11 and September 24, 1992. Mr. Megraw has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000096.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1972 a four man fishing and trapping team was returning from Lynn Lake on dog sleds after purchasing supplies. Mr. Bonner and his friend were in the lead sled. The team that was traveling with them was approximately 2.5 km behind. When approximately 183 metres from Mr. Bonner's sled, they noticed both men had gone through the ice. Once on scene both men had disappeared beneath the water. One of the men was pulled from the water but could not be revived. Mr. Bonner never resurfaced and despite dragging operations he could not be located.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"

Case reference: 2014004899.CaseDesc: Claude Barbier was last seen on November 16, 1996, with his girlfriend at the Cooke residence in Trois-Rivières. On November 18, 1996, the body of his girlfriend was pulled from the St-Lawrence River near St-Antoine-de-Tilly. Mr. Barbier has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004320.CaseDesc: On February 22, 2002, Alexandre Fortin was seen for the last time in a home situated on road 127 in Saint-Georges, Quebec. Over the course of the night, a fire completely destroyed the residence and Alexandre remains missing, despite search operations.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014038571.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1983, the body of this adult male was found on the south shore of Kamloops Lake east of the community of Savona in British Columbia. He had long black hair and numerous tattoos on his arms. It is believed he was deceased a few months prior to his body being recovered.

Tattoo: Left Arm, Mary C and Love, Marlene and Karene crossed-out
Right Arm, Edna and another unidentifiable tattoo

Case reference: 2008002899.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1998 Melvin Spence, an offshore laborer, left the farm he was employed at and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020007795.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1972, at around midnight, James Edwards was last seen in his Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) uniform leaving for work in Toronto, Ontario. TTC advised that James had submitted his resignation before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003919.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2000, Ronald Montgomery went missing from his home in Calgary. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2019032078.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2019, at aprroximately 2:19 pm, Shauranne Humphry was seen for the last time at the Anduhyaun Shelter in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005271.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2009, Fanzheng Meng was seen for the last time at Britannia Park and Beach in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Meng and another man had been aboard an inflatable raft on the Ottawa River. The two men did not return to the shore and the deflated raft was subsequently located.

Case reference: 2006025899.CaseDesc: Robin Windross has not been seen since November 1977. He has an intellectual age of about 6 years old, speaks with a strong speech impediment and is difficult to understand. He may have left Huronia Regional Centre because he was concerned about being transferred in the facility to a unit with mostly adults. He had always been housed with children.

Case reference: 2014005031.CaseDesc: Eric Gagnon was seen for the last time over the course of the night on May 25-26, 1996 in Trois-Pistoles, Quebec. Eric drove his ex-girlfriend to "Le Bellevue" Night Club sometime in the early hours of the evening. His vehicle was later recovered at his home.

Case reference: 2014005423.CaseDesc: On January 22, 1971, Maryse Chalette was seen for the last time when she went out for a walk at approximately 12:30 p.m., in the Joliette area in Quebec. Maryse was placed in foster care by the CHRDL Hospital.

Case reference: 2020038049.CaseDesc: On March 27, 2020, Joshua Reiner was reported missing to New York Police, in the United States. Joshua’s vehicle was located in Niagara Falls, New York. A male was later observed on surveillance cameras climbing over a railing and walking towards the brink of the falls. The male was later confirmed to be Joshua Reiner by family members. It is suspected that he jumped into the falls and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2005004999.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1995, the body of an unidentified man was found in the lower part of the Niagara River. The man suffered from gynecomastia; a condition that enlarged his breasts.

Case reference: 2006020099.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1974, Louis Wesley was last seen in Chamberlain Narrows, Lac Seul. He was involved in a boating accident and is presumed to have drowned in the lake, 48 km north of Hudson. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2014005537.CaseDesc: Kerry Klyne was last seen while working at the Dakota Hotel.  Mr. Klyne's whereabouts remains unknown.

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Tribal art/Band around biceps

Case reference: 2018056500.CaseDesc: On August 2 1997, Ronald Halpern was last seen leaving his residence to go to the Toronto International Airport. Ronald boarded a flight traveling to the Dominican Republic.

Case reference: 2014004578.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Tardif was last seen on August 7, 2003. He fell from his boat, a 14-foot motorboat, on Lake Devenys in the unorganized territories north of St-Michel-des-Saints. Mr. Tardif has never been seen since.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Calf, Tibia and perone fragments

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2014002921.CaseDesc: Alban Robichaud has been missing since May 30, 1991. Alban was employed with City Laundry and left this day at 3pm. Alban was seen in various uptown Saint John pubs and was last seen at Gene's Country Palace between 11:00 & 11:30 pm.

Case reference: 2014022855.CaseDesc: In February 2013, a human skull was turned into Hinton RCMP by the Groeneveldt family. They located the skull in their garage under items that had been tucked away since the homeowner Leo Groeneveldt passed away many years earlier. The family believes Mr. Groeneveldt received the skull as a gag gift at a party he attended in Hinton in the late 1960s or early 1970s. The exact origin of the skull is unknown. Forensic examination of the skull shows it is that of an aboriginal male.
